en: A ship sank near here yesterday.
zh: 昨天这附近沉了一艘船。

en: I just got back from the States yesterday, so I'm still thinking in English.
zh: 我昨天刚从美国回来，所以思维还没从英语转过来。

en: We had a spell of fine weather last autumn.
zh: 去年秋天天气有一阵子特别好。

en: Recently we have had several disasters.
zh: 最近发生了好几起灾难。

en: Nowadays prices of commodities are very high.
zh: 现在物价太高了。

en: Personal liberty is diminishing nowadays.
zh: 现在个人自由越来越少了。

en: What is important in writing a composition is to make your ideas clear.
zh: 写作文最重要的就是要把意思表达清楚。

en: Have you finished writing your composition?
zh: 你作文写完了吗？

en: The crops have withered.
zh: 庄稼都枯萎了。

en: The crop was blasted by the severe winter.
zh: 庄稼被寒冬冻坏了。

en: It was believed that the success of their crops depended on the way the players threw or kicked the ball during the game.
zh: 以前人们觉得庄稼收成怎么样，全看球员在比赛里怎么传球或踢球。

en: I read in the newspaper recently that the crops really need rain.
zh: 我最近看报纸说，庄稼真得下点雨才行。

en: High operating temperatures shorten lubricant life.
zh: 运行温度太高会缩短润滑油的使用寿命。

en: The author expresses his passion for his love.
zh: 作者表达了他对爱人的深情。

en: You have to read between the lines to know the true intention of the author.
zh: 你得读出言外之意，才能明白作者的真实意图。

en: Composers create music.
zh: 作曲家创作音乐。

en: Which of the composers do you like best?
zh: 这些作曲家里你最喜欢哪一个？

en: You must be creative in composing a piece of music.
zh: 作曲的时候你得有创意。

en: The workers are wiring the new house.
zh: 工人们正在给新房子排线。

en: We saw laborers blasting rocks.
zh: 我们看到工人们正在炸石头。

en: Workers must have their hair cut short.
zh: 工人必须把头发剪短。

en: The writer does not always present life as it is.
zh: 作家并不总是按生活的原样来描写。

en: Every writer writes in the way that accords with his own idiosyncrasies.
zh: 每个作家都有自己独特的写作风格。

en: Writers draw on their imagination.
zh: 作家靠的是想象力。

en: Writers often refer to a dictionary.
zh: 作家也经常查字典。

en: As a writer, she does not fit into any of the traditional categories.
zh: 作为一名作家，她不属于任何传统流派。

en: Much as I admire him as a writer, I don't like him as a man.
zh: 虽然我很佩服他的才华，但我并不喜欢他这个人。

en: Was it difficult to make?
zh: 这个做起来难吗？

en: There is a river between Saitama and Chiba.
zh: 埼玉和千叶之间有一条河。

en: A Mr Sakaki has come to see you.
zh: 有位榊先生来找你。

en: A Mr. Sakaki has come to see you.
zh: 有位榊先生来找你。

en: In the Hanshin earthquake, the ground shook for a long time.
zh: 阪神大地震的时候，地面晃了很久。

en: Hanshin's moment of glory didn't last. They fell out of first place in a hurry.
zh: 阪神队的辉煌没持续多久，很快就掉出第一名了。

en: Keep up the good work, Mr. Sakamoto.
zh: 坂本先生，请继续努力。

en: Kounosuke Sakazaki belongs to "THE ALFEE".
zh: 坂崎幸之助是“THE ALFEE”乐队的成员。

en: With respect to financial matters, Mr Jones knows more than anyone else in the company.
zh: 说到财务问题，琼斯先生比公司里的任何人都懂。

en: With respect to financial matters, Mr. Jones knows more than anyone else in the company.
zh: 说到财务问题，琼斯先生比公司里的任何人都懂。

en: Don't lose your purse.
zh: 别把钱包弄丢了。

en: Will you help me look for my purse?
zh: 能帮我找找钱包吗？

en: When I felt for my pocketbook I found it was gone.
zh: 我摸口袋的时候发现钱包不见了。

en: He said that he had left his purse at home and asked me if I could lend him 1,000 yen.
zh: 他说他把钱包忘家里了，问我能不能借他一千日元。

en: Since he had left his wallet at home, he asked me if I could lend him 1,000 yen.
zh: 因为他把钱包落家里了，他问我能不能借他一千日元。

en: It occurred to me that I had left my purse at home.
zh: 我突然想起我把钱包落家里了。

en: Who holds the purse, rules the house.
zh: 谁管钱谁当家。

en: Don't put the wallet on the top of the heater.
zh: 别把钱包放在暖气片上。

en: All that day my father was out of humor because he had lost his wallet.
zh: 那天我爸心情一直不好，因为他把钱包丢了。

en: I lost my wallet somewhere around here.
zh: 我钱包在这附近什么地方丢了。

en: Put away your wallet.
zh: 把钱包收起来。

en: I'm looking for a wallet.
zh: 我在找钱包。

en: I examined the purse again, and found it empty.
zh: 我又检查了一下钱包，发现里面是空的。

en: We have to be careful with expenses.
zh: 我们得省着点花。

en: Empty the purse into this bag.
zh: 把钱包里的东西都倒进这个包里。

en: I have no more money in my wallet.
zh: 我钱包里没钱了。

en: There was no money left in my wallet.
zh: 我钱包里一分钱都不剩了。

en: I put my money in a purse.
zh: 我把钱放进钱包里了。

en: My wallet and passport are missing.
zh: 我的钱包和护照不见了。

en: A heavy purse makes a light heart.
zh: 钱包鼓鼓，心里不慌。

en: Gold prices are skyrocketing in the wake of financial instability.
zh: 因为金融动荡，金价正疯涨。

en: Financial support is given to them.
zh: 他们得到了资金支持。

en: A common way to finance a budget deficit is to issue bonds.
zh: 弥补财政赤字的常见办法是发债券。

en: Reducing the budget deficit is a major concern of the government.
zh: 缩减财政赤字是政府最关心的事。

en: The financial situation is getting worse week by week.
zh: 财务状况一周比一周糟。

en: Some developing countries are faced with financial crises.
zh: 一些发展中国家正面临金融危机。

en: Financial reforms may ameliorate the current economic difficulties.
zh: 金融改革可能会缓解目前的经济困难。

en: Financial experts don't know what to make of this trend.
zh: 金融专家也不知道该怎么看这个趋势。

en: He that marries for wealth sells his liberty.
zh: 为了钱而结婚的人，等于是出卖了自己的自由。

en: The division of the property was a bone of contention between the brothers.
zh: 财产分配是兄弟俩争执的焦点。

en: I succeed to a fortune.
zh: 我继承了一大笔财富。

en: He exploited his position to build up his fortune.
zh: 他利用职务之便发了财。

en: Don't make such a parade of your wealth.
zh: 别这么显摆你有钱。

en: The property passed from father to son.
zh: 财产由父亲传给了儿子。

en: The property was divided equally among the heirs.
zh: 财产在继承人之间平分了。

en: The fortune was divided among the three brothers.
zh: 遗产由三兄弟平分了。

en: The criminal pleaded with him to change his mind.
zh: 罪犯哀求他改变主意。

en: The criminal was sent to the gallows.
zh: 罪犯被送上了绞刑架。

en: If you commit a crime, you must be punished.
zh: 犯了罪就得受罚。

en: The wages of sin is death.
zh: 罪恶的代价就是死亡。

en: The salaryman went to live quietly in a remote area in order to atone for his sins.
zh: 那个上班族为了赎罪，去了一个偏远的地方隐居。

en: The guilt manifests itself on his face.
zh: 他的脸上写满了愧疚。

en: The punishment should be in proportion to the crime.
zh: 处罚应当与罪行相称。

en: What's the material?
zh: 这是什么料子的？

en: That was a close shave.
zh: 刚才真险。

en: I had a close shave.
zh: 我刚才好悬。

en: The presiding judge was touched by pity for the accused.
zh: 审判长对被告产生了怜悯之心。

en: The presiding judge sentenced the defendant to death.
zh: 审判长判处被告死刑。

en: The judge called for a recess of two hours.
zh: 法官宣布休庭两小时。

en: The court decreed that she should pay the fine.
zh: 法院裁定她必须缴纳罚金。

en: The court ordered her to pay the fine.
zh: 法院命令她缴纳罚金。

en: The court adjudged him not guilty.
zh: 法院判定他无罪。

en: The court decreed that the charge be paid.
zh: 法院裁定必须支付费用。

en: The court called on the lawyer to give evidence.
zh: 法院要求律师提供证据。

en: The attitude of the court toward young criminals is different from its attitude toward adult criminals.
zh: 法院对待青少年犯罪的态度与对待成年犯不同。

en: The courts administer the law.
zh: 法院负责执行法律。

en: The judge charged the audience to be silent.
zh: 法官要求旁听席保持安静。

en: The judge disposed of the case in short order.
zh: 法官很快就处理完了这个案子。

en: The judge sentenced him to a fine.
zh: 法官判他交罚金。

en: Will the judge fine him heavily?
zh: 法官会重重地罚他吗？

en: The judge condemned him to death.
zh: 法官判处了他死刑。

en: The judge sentenced him to a jail term of five years.
zh: 法官判了他五年监禁。

en: The judge decided against the plaintiff.
zh: 法官判原告败诉。

en: The judge made no bones about his disgust with the accused's actions and handed down the severest sentence possible.
zh: 法官毫不掩饰对被告行为的厌恶，并给予了最严厉的判决。

en: The judge pardoned the prisoner a year of his sentence.
zh: 法官减免了犯人一年的刑期。

en: The judge concluded that the prisoner was guilty.
zh: 法官认定犯人有罪。

en: The judge took into consideration the fact that it was his first offense.
zh: 法官考虑到了他是初犯。

en: The judge concluded that the prisoner was innocent.
zh: 法官认定那个囚犯是清白的。

en: Mr. Yappari appealed to the judge for mercy.
zh: 矢张先生请求法官宽大处理。

en: Discretion is proper to judges.
zh: 审慎是法官应有的素质。

en: The judge pronounced him "guilty", and now he must face the music of a sentence in prison.
zh: 法官判了他有罪，现在他必须面对坐牢的现实了。

en: Suspending the trial is out of the question.
zh: 中止审理是不可能的。

en: The court session lasted for three hours.
zh: 庭审持续了三个小时。

en: Judgment requires impartiality.
zh: 判决需要客观公正。

en: The lawsuit is likely to end in our defeat.
zh: 这场官司我们可能会输。

en: The trial lasted for ten consecutive days.
zh: 审理连续进行了十天。

en: Let's take it to court.
zh: 咱们法庭上见。

en: Can you recommend any vegetarian dishes?
zh: 有什么素菜推荐吗？

en: Do you have a special menu for vegetarians?
zh: 你们有专门的素食菜单吗？

en: Remember to cross your t's.
zh: 记得要把细节处理好。

en: They made a whip out of cords.
zh: 他们用绳索做了一把鞭子。

en: Muriel is living poorly off of her part-time job.
zh: 穆丽尔靠兼职过得紧巴巴的。

en: Muriel is making a poor living from her part-time job.
zh: 穆丽尔靠兼职勉强糊口。

en: Germs are too tiny for our eyes to see.
zh: 细菌太小了，肉眼看不见。

en: Germs can only be seen with the aid of a microscope.
zh: 细菌只有通过显微镜才能看到。

en: Germs can cause sickness.
zh: 细菌会致病。

en: Particles of dust float in the atmosphere.
zh: 灰尘颗粒在空气中飘浮。

en: You may leave out the details.
zh: 细节可以略过。

en: A fine rain was falling.
zh: 外面下着毛毛细雨。

en: Let's arrange the details later.
zh: 细节咱们以后再商量。

en: He who minds his Ps and Qs will not forget to dot the "i's" and cross his "t's", when writing.
zh: 举止谨慎的人，写起字来也会非常细心。

en: Don't split hairs.
zh: 别钻牛角尖。

en: Let's not quibble over trivial matters.
zh: 咱们别在琐事上斤斤计较了。

en: Do you remember Mr Saito?
zh: 你还记得斋藤先生吗？

en: Do you remember Mr. Saito?
zh: 你还记得斋藤先生吗？

en: When a holiday falls on Sunday, we have an extra holiday on Monday.
zh: 节假日要是赶上周日，周一就会补假。

en: The festival came to an end.
zh: 庆典结束了。

en: The fort was attacked by surprise.
zh: 堡垒遭到了奇袭。

en: A string of disasters struck the region.
zh: 那个地区接连遭受灾难。

en: Good comes out of evil.
zh: 因祸得福。

en: Make the best of a bad bargain.
zh: 尽量在逆境中做到最好吧。

en: To turn a disaster into an opportunity.
zh: 化危机为转机。

en: Turn your misfortune to account.
zh: 利用好你的霉运。

en: You can critique it all you want and it won't change a thing. It's over.
zh: 你想怎么批评都行，但已经改变不了什么了。都过去了。

en: Bring it back when you are through.
zh: 用完以后记得还回来。

en: Don't worry about what you've done.
zh: 别为你做过的事担心。

en: Excuse me. Can I get by here?
zh: 不好意思，借过一下。

en: Revenues are growing, but not as fast as costs.
zh: 收入在增长，但赶不上成本增长的速度。

en: Time and tide wait for no man.
zh: 岁月不等人。

en: Age, like distance, lends a double charm.
zh: 岁月和距离一样，都能增加魅力。

en: The year stole by.
zh: 这一年不知不觉就过去了。

en: In order to get the soil ready for planting you must plow it.
zh: 播种前得先把地耕了。

en: If we decide to hire you, you will hear from us.
zh: 如果我们决定录用你，会通知你的。

en: Did you mark the papers?
zh: 卷子批改了吗？

en: Did you grade the tests?
zh: 考试打分了吗？

en: There was no one in the mine when it blew up.
zh: 矿井爆炸的时候，里面一个人也没有。

en: Want of wit is worse than want of gear.
zh: 没脑子比没装备更糟糕。

en: She just hides her light under a bushel.
zh: 她就是太低调了，不爱显摆。

en: One's talent is in need of discipline.
zh: 有才华也需要好好磨练才行。

en: You shouldn't give up just because you have no talent.
zh: 你不能因为觉得自己没天赋就放弃啊。

en: You can't keep a good man down.
zh: 是金子总会发光的。

en: She is as wise as fair.
zh: 她既聪明又漂亮。

en: Whom the gods love die young.
zh: 好人不长命。

en: Hatoyama says that he supports his family by gambling on horse racing.
zh: 鸠山说他是靠赌马养活家人的。

en: Wife and children are hostages given to fortune.
zh: 有了老婆孩子，做事就没那么洒脱了。

en: I hurried to the station as I had kept my wife waiting.
zh: 我赶紧往车站赶，因为我让我老婆在那儿久等了。

en: I talked my wife out of buying a new car.
zh: 我说服了我老婆先别买新车。

en: Hoping to cheer up his wife, Tom bought her a beautiful pearl necklace.
zh: 为了哄老婆开心，汤姆给她买了一条漂亮的珍珠项链。

en: I'm looking for a gift for my wife.
zh: 我在给我老婆挑礼物。

en: My wife suggested to me that I take her on the trip.
zh: 我老婆建议我带她一起去旅行。

en: My wife wanted to adopt a child.
zh: 我老婆想领养个孩子。

en: My wife is getting tired of the daily routine.
zh: 我老婆厌倦了这种一成不变的日常生活。

en: My wife is liable to catch a cold.
zh: 我老婆很容易感冒。

en: My wife catches colds easily.
zh: 我老婆特别容易感冒。

en: My wife gave me a sign from across the room.
zh: 我老婆在屋子另一头给我使了个眼色。

en: Wives usually outlive husbands.
zh: 通常老婆都比老公长寿。

en: A wife can have property independent of her husband.
zh: 妻子可以拥有独立于丈夫的个人财产。

en: His wife ran a hot bath for him.
zh: 他老婆给他放好了洗澡水。

en: My wife went on a two-day trip.
zh: 我老婆去旅行了，要去两天。

en: My wife shuddered at the sight of a one-eyed cat.
zh: 我老婆一看到那只独眼猫就吓得打了个冷颤。

en: My wife is ignorant of the world.
zh: 我老婆不太懂人情世故。

en: My wife deliberated whether we would buy a new house or not.
zh: 我老婆在纠结咱们到底买不买新房子。

en: My wife goes to the village market to buy foods every day.
zh: 我老婆每天都去村里的集市买菜。

en: My wife tried to persuade me into buying a new car.
zh: 我老婆想说服我买辆新车。

en: My wife gets on well with my mother.
zh: 我老婆和我妈相处得挺好的。

en: My wife is suffering from pneumonia.
zh: 我老婆得了肺炎。

en: After getting married, my wife put on five pounds.
zh: 结婚以后，我老婆胖了五磅。

en: My wife looked surprised.
zh: 我老婆一脸惊讶。

en: My wife is subject to moods.
zh: 我老婆这人挺情绪化的。

en: My wife died of cancer.
zh: 我老婆是得癌症去世的。

en: My wife likes to eat out and so she doesn't have to cook.
zh: 我老婆喜欢在外面吃，这样她就不用做饭了。

en: My wife is possessed with the desire to buy a house.
zh: 我老婆一心就想着买房子。

en: My wife used to stay home, but she works now.
zh: 我老婆以前是家庭主妇，但现在出来上班了。

en: My wife remembered having been in the town before.
zh: 我老婆记得她以前来过这个镇子。

en: My wife is a good manager.
zh: 我老婆挺会持家的。

en: My wife spends money as if I were the richest man in town.
zh: 我老婆花起钱来，就好像我是全城首富似的。

en: My wife works part time.
zh: 我老婆在做兼职。

en: My wife usually doesn't drink coffee at night. I don't either.
zh: 我老婆晚上通常不喝咖啡，我也一样。

en: My wife has just cleared the table.
zh: 我老婆刚收拾完桌子。

en: My wife is always complaining about something.
zh: 我老婆总是在抱怨这抱怨那的。

en: My wife had a hard time getting into the swing of our new life in America.
zh: 我老婆好不容易才适应了美国的生活节奏。

en: My wife has had it in for me since I forgot her birthday.
zh: 自从我忘了她的生日，我老婆就一直看我不顺眼。

en: He did not even raise an eyebrow at the news of his wife's death.
zh: 听到他老婆的死讯，他甚至连眉头都没皱一下。

en: The untimely death of my wife has brought down the curtain on over 50 years of happily married life.
zh: 我妻子的不幸离世，为我们五十多年的美满婚姻画上了句号。

en: Without his wife's money, he would never be a director.
zh: 要是没他老婆的钱，他根本当不上董事。

en: A wife's activities are confined to domestic matters.
zh: 妻子的活动范围仅限于家务琐事。

en: My wife's constant nagging really gets on my nerves.
zh: 我老婆总是唠叨个没完，真是让我心烦。

en: He took to drinking after his wife left him.
zh: 他老婆离开他之后，他就开始酗酒了。

en: I'm looking for a bag for my wife.
zh: 我在给我老婆挑个包。

en: My wife's constant nagging is getting me down.
zh: 我老婆整天没完没了地唠叨，真让我受不了。

en: My wife has faults. None the less, I love her.
zh: 我老婆虽然有缺点，但我还是很爱她。

en: My wife and I like to go out for Chinese food once in a while.
zh: 我和我老婆偶尔喜欢去外面吃中餐。

en: I constantly quarrel with my wife.
zh: 我老是跟我老婆吵架。

en: My wife and children depend on me.
zh: 我老婆孩子都得靠我养活。

en: Jim sometimes has disagreements with his wife.
zh: 吉姆偶尔会和他老婆闹点小矛盾。

en: I decided to wait at the station until my wife came.
zh: 我决定在车站等着，直到我老婆过来。

en: The bus had left by the time my wife finished dressing.
zh: 等我老婆穿戴好，车都开走了。

en: If my wife calls, just tell her I'm in an important meeting and cannot be disturbed.

zh: 弗兰克，你最近怎么样？

en: I'm not in good shape now.
zh: 我最近状态不太好。

en: The condition seems to be bad recently.
zh: 最近情况好像不太妙。

en: Recently the number of worms increased.
zh: 最近虫子变多了。

en: You've been late for school more often than before.
zh: 你最近上学迟到的次数比以前多了。

en: It scares me that we have frequently had earthquakes lately.
zh: 最近地震这么频繁，挺吓人的。

en: Recently, many public bath-houses have gone out of business.
zh: 最近很多澡堂都关门了。

en: Recently the condition of the body is not so good.
zh: 最近身体不太舒服。

en: Recently numerous groups have offered counsel.
zh: 最近有很多团体提供了咨询。

en: Many women work outside their homes these days.
zh: 现在很多女性都在外工作。

en: A number of traffic accidents have happened recently.
zh: 最近发生了很多交通事故。

en: Recently, many traffic accidents have occurred on that road.
zh: 那条路上最近出了好几起交通事故。

en: There seems to be no end to the number of young people committing suicide these days.
zh: 最近年轻人自杀的事儿感觉没完没了。

en: Recently I have had no appetite.
zh: 我最近没什么胃口。

en: Of all the books published recently, only a few are worth reading.
zh: 最近出的这些书里，没几本值得读的。

en: I feel like I'm just getting comfortable with my homemaking chores.
zh: 我感觉我才刚刚适应做家务。

en: Recently the number of cars has greatly increased.
zh: 最近车子变多了很多。

en: My vision is getting worse these days.
zh: 我最近视力越来越差了。

en: I was recently in an automobile accident.
zh: 我最近出了一场车祸。

en: These days I'm very busy.
zh: 我这几天特别忙。

en: Recently I moved to another apartment.
zh: 我最近搬家了。

en: I have seen nothing of him recently.
zh: 我最近都没见到他。

en: I can not get enough sleep any more.
zh: 我最近老是睡不够。

en: I've been sluggish recently.
zh: 我最近总觉得没精打采的。

en: You hear about a lot of incidents these days that would be hard to dream up. It really backs up the old saying that fact is stranger than fiction.
zh: 最近总能听到些稀奇古怪的事，真是应了那句话，现实比小说还离奇。

en: I want to hear all your news.
zh: 我想听听你的所有近况。

en: Recently communism has extended its power.
zh: 最近共产主义势力有所扩张。

en: Recently, more and more countries have prohibited smoking.
zh: 最近越来越多的国家开始禁烟了。

en: I've taken up painting recently.
zh: 我最近开始学画画了。

en: The number of students going overseas has been increasing lately.
zh: 最近出国留学的学生越来越多了。

en: Society has seen a lot of change recently.
zh: 最近社会变化挺大的。

en: Now the company can justify such expenditure.
zh: 现在公司这笔支出说得通了。

en: Have you read anything interesting lately?
zh: 你最近有读到什么有趣的东西吗？

en: Two books stand out among the dozens recently published on the Royal Family.
zh: 最近出版了几十本关于皇室的书，其中有两本特别出挑。

en: Lately you see more young couples making out at the train station ticket gates acting as though nobody in the world existed.
zh: 最近在火车站检票口经常能看到小情侣在那亲亲我我，旁若无人的。

en: Have you seen any movies lately?
zh: 你最近看电影了吗？

en: The room I've moved into recently gets plenty of sunshine.
zh: 我刚搬进来的这间房采光很好。

en: These days many old people live by themselves.
zh: 现在很多老人都是独自生活。

en: We go there often.
zh: 我们经常去那儿。

en: Rapid and remarkable advances have been made in medicine.
zh: 医学领域最近取得了突飞猛进的发展。

en: I've seen much of him recently.
zh: 我最近经常见到他。

en: I've seen a lot of him recently.
zh: 我最近总跟他见面。

en: Something's wrong with my e-mail.
zh: 我的电子邮件出问题了。

en: Until recently we took oil for granted.
zh: 直到最近，我们还觉得有石油是理所当然的事。

en: Until recently, the main function of women was to marry and give birth to children.
zh: 就在不久前，女性的主要职责还是结婚生子。

en: Life is getting hard these days.
zh: 最近日子越来越不好过了。

en: We haven't heard from her of late.
zh: 我们最近一直没她的消息。

en: I have heard nothing from him of late.
zh: 我最近一直没他的消息。

en: Recently, the number of foreigners working or studying in Japan has increased.
zh: 最近在日本工作或学习的外国人变多了。

en: I've got little time for reading these days.
zh: 我最近都没什么时间看书。

en: Nowadays nobody believes in ghosts.
zh: 现在没人相信有鬼了。

en: There's a trend these days towards small families.
zh: 现在的趋势是向小家庭化发展。

en: Nowadays many people travel by car.
zh: 现在很多人都开车旅行。

en: I have hardly had a minute lately to think about personal e-mails.
zh: 我最近忙得根本没空去想个人邮件的事。

en: Now we are having one cold day after another.
zh: 最近这天真是一天比一天冷。

en: Recently even students have come to visit foreign countries quite often.
zh: 最近连学生都经常出国旅游了。

en: Nothing I do lately seems to turn out right. I'm losing confidence in myself.
zh: 最近我干什么都不顺，都快没信心了。

en: We often have unusual weather these days.
zh: 最近天气总是不太正常。

en: Nowadays, a safety zone is not always safe.
zh: 现在这年头，安全区也不一定安全。

en: Everybody is happy nowadays.
zh: 现在大家都过得挺开心的。

en: Lately everyone seems happy.
zh: 最近大家看着都挺开心的。

en: What are you into these days?
zh: 你最近对什么感兴趣？

en: A lot of construction is going on these days.
zh: 最近到处都在搞建设。

en: I started using PCs recently.
zh: 我最近开始用电脑了。

en: I see little of my father these days.
zh: 我最近很少见到我爸。

en: A dollar does not go very far these days.
zh: 现在一美元根本买不了什么。

en: These days more and more young people talk to their elders on even terms.
zh: 现在越来越多的年轻人跟长辈平起平坐地说话了。

en: Lately the discount airline ticket system has gotten so complicated that there's a lot about it I can't figure out.
zh: 最近打折机票的系统变得太复杂了，好多地方我都搞不明白。

en: These days the number of women who don't want to change their family names even after they get married is increasing.
zh: 现在结婚后不想改姓的女性越来越多了。

en: I've been coming to work one train earlier lately.
zh: 我最近上班都提前一班车。

en: Modern cats don't eat rats.
zh: 现在的猫都不吃老鼠了。

en: Recent comics have too many violent and sexual scenes.
zh: 最近的漫画里暴力和色情的内容太多了。

en: The modern Japanese politics is bad.
zh: 现在的日本政治真是糟透了。

en: What do you think are the best sellers of the latest Japanese records?
zh: 你觉得最近日本唱片里卖得最好的是哪些？

en: A recent survey revealed that the population density in the metropolis was decreasing.
zh: 最近的一项调查显示，大城市的人口密度正在下降。

en: A recent survey reveals that the population density in the metropolis is decreasing.
zh: 最近的一项调查表明，大城市的人口密度在减少。

en: Modern ships only need a small crew.
zh: 现在的船只需要很少的船员就能操作。

en: Lately high school girls are using their cell phones to exchange e-mail.
zh: 最近高中女生都在用手机发邮件。

en: These days more young husbands help their wives with housework.
zh: 现在越来越多的年轻丈夫会帮妻子做家务了。

en: I can't keep up with the fashions of young girls these days.
zh: 我现在跟不上年轻女孩的流行趋势了。

en: Some of these young people have legs twice as long as mine.
zh: 现在的有些年轻人，腿长得简直是我的两倍。

en: The president made special remarks with reference accident in the nuclear reactor.
zh: 总统就核反应堆事故发表了特别讲话。

en: According to a recent study, the average life span of the Japanese is still increasing.
zh: 根据最近的一项研究，日本人的平均寿命还在增长。

en: Recent investigations have demonstrated that the application of Emmet's theory is not always without defects.
zh: 最近的调查表明，艾米特理论的应用并不总是完美的。

en: These bank employees seem so politely insolent lately. I wonder what's behind it.
zh: 这些银行职员最近礼貌得让人觉得傲慢，不知道是怎么回事。

en: These days when I hear about these horrible incidents on the news I get the feeling that more and more young people are losing their ability to distinguish between real and virtual worlds.
zh: 最近在新闻里看到这些可怕的事件，我觉得越来越多的年轻人已经分不清现实和虚拟世界了。

en: Recent overseas transfers show that productivity improvements in Japanese manufacturing industry have almost reached their limit.
zh: 最近的海外转移显示，日本制造业的生产效率提升已经快到极限了。

en: Pro baseball is interesting these days.
zh: 最近的职业棒球挺有意思的。

en: Due to the recent hurricane, a lot of people lost their homes.
zh: 因为最近的那场飓风，很多人都失去了家园。

en: I'm really not up on recent TV shows.
zh: 我最近真没怎么关注过电视节目。

en: The recent shortage of coffee has given rise to a lot of problems.
zh: 最近的咖啡短缺引发了很多问题。

en: I'd appreciate it if you sent me your latest catalog.
zh: 如果您能把最新的产品目录寄给我，我将不胜感激。

en: A recent survey shows that the number of smokers is decreasing.
zh: 最近的调查显示，吸烟的人数正在减少。

en: How is livelihood in America these day?
zh: 美国最近的生活怎么样？

en: It was not until recently that she changed her mind.
zh: 直到最近她才改变主意。

en: It is only recently that people have begun to realize the importance of nature conservation.
zh: 直到最近，人们才开始意识到保护自然的重要性。

en: How have you been recently?
zh: 你最近怎么样？

en: Many old people these days cannot keep up with the times.
zh: 现在很多老年人都跟不上时代了。

en: Nowadays it is not unusual for a woman to travel alone.
zh: 现如今，女性独自旅行已经不稀奇了。

en: Nowadays it isn't unusual for a woman to travel alone.
zh: 在现在的社会，女性一个人去旅行是很平常的事。

en: There is little harmony in international affairs nowadays.
zh: 现在的国际事务中几乎看不到什么和谐可言。

en: Recently John feels better on and off.
zh: 最近约翰的感觉总是好一阵坏一阵的。

en: Many old people these days can't keep up with the times.
zh: 现在的很多老人家都跟不上时代了。

en: These days, when people emigrate, it is not so much in search of sunshine, or food, or even servants.
zh: 现在的人移民，与其说是为了寻找阳光、食物甚至是佣人，倒不如说是为了别的。

en: More and more Japanese are traveling abroad these days.
zh: 最近出国旅游的日本人越来越多了。

en: Recently I started the diet.
zh: 我最近开始减肥了。

en: I'm tied up with this job recently.
zh: 我最近被这工作给拴住了。

en: I just bought a new desk for my computer.
zh: 我刚给电脑买了张新桌子。

en: Have you heard from your sister lately?
zh: 最近有你姐姐的消息吗？

en: I have not seen anything of Elizabeth lately.
zh: 我最近都没见到伊丽莎白。

en: The new camera our company has been marketing lately has a design different from any we've marketed before.
zh: 公司最近推出来的这款新相机，设计跟我们以前的所有款式都不一样。

en: We don't meet very often recently.
zh: 我们最近见得不多。

en: Prices dropped recently.
zh: 物价最近跌了。

en: Prices have dropped recently.
zh: 价格最近已经降下来了。

en: Could I be going soft in the head? I forget things so easily these days.
zh: 我是不是脑子不好使了？最近怎么老忘事儿。

en: Lately, he reproaches me.
zh: 最近他老是责备我。

en: Recently he bothers me.
zh: 最近他总是烦我。

en: Recently I get annoyed at the slightest thing he says.
zh: 最近不管他说什么，我都会觉得特别烦。

en: We haven't heard of him lately.
zh: 我们最近都没听说过他的消息。

en: I haven't seen anything of him lately.
zh: 我最近都没见过他。
